subject: p13896515
History: Year old man with new BiVICD implant, evaluate for lead placement and pneumothorax.
Findings: Appearance of the median sternotomy wires are unchanged. Again noted is the biventricular ICD implant one lead is seen in the right atrium, a second lead within the right ventricle but the tip of the third lead is not well visualized. There is slight improvement of underlying pulmonary edema compared to. Again noted is a small left pleural effusion. The heart is enlarged. No evidence of pneumothorax.
Impression: Interval biventricular ICD placement. No evidence of pneumothorax. Slight improvement in pulmonary edema.
